name: My3dMusicPlayer (temporary name)
description:
What is FP

View the music libraries that you store on your computer in first person

What you need

For the proper functioning of the program you will need:

A general folder with the folders of all the albums 

The folder with the name of the album, has to have: 

· The songs (the audio files  must be .MP3 or .FLAC)

· The cover (.PNG .JPG .JPEG)

Controls

If you are very close to the albums you can keep the mouse still and go through the album by pressing Q and E

Left Click on the album to display the list of music it contains.

Right Click to close.

You can turn the page with the buttons below

Press TAB to open the library creation window

Here you can select the number of albums you want per shelf 

example with music i have from bandcamp

And the path to the folder where your digital music library is located 

Once selected press Create to generate.

Press SPACE to open the music controller 

From here you can select to move to a specific point in the song 

You can pause the current song or go to the next one on the disc 

You can activate the loop mode so you don't stop listening to the same song

Notes

In the case of not finding an image, one is assigned by default

No built-in Chinese, Japanese, etc. characters

Album titles with strange characters can lead to import problems.

In the future

-Background mode:

To be able to continue listening to music but with the program running in the background, and consuming less

-Volume control

-Customize Crosshair

-Be able to organize the bookcases in different positions

-Classify the Albums by Authors or Musical Genre
